activities:
GoPro collects data during certain transactions and communications with its customers, including when consumers/users register to use GoPro products and services, purchase GoPro products and services, register GoPro hardware and software, apply for commercial credit, and participate in surveys or contests. 

Customer data may be transferred from EU-based GoPro subsidiaries to GoPro (which is located in the United States) for the purposes of marketing, supporting transactions, security, customer and technical support, customer communications, improving GoPro products and services, auditing, data analysis, and data storage.

GoPro also receives personal information relating to employees of its subsidiaries located in the European Union and European Economic Area to carry out and support human resources functions and activities.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
industrysector: Consumer Electronics - (CEL)Photographic Equipment - (PHT)Computer Software - (CSF)Sporting Goods & Recreational Equipment - (SPT)
personaldata: On-line, off-line, and manually processed customer data
recoursemech: Consumers should contact the BBB's EU Safe Harbor Dispute Resolution Program ( http://www.bbb.org/us/european-dispute-resolution/consumer/ ) with privacy complaints or concerns.
